title: Derivative of inverse trigonometric functions: cot(x)
text: The formula for the derivative of inverse cot(x) is $$\frac{d}{dx} {cot}^{\left(-1\right)} x=\left(-\frac{1}{1+x^2}\right)$$
speech: The formula for the derivative of inverse cot(x) is  fraction, d over, d x,  the parentheses negative 1  power of, cotangent of x is equal to parentheses negative fraction, 1 over, 1 plus x squared,

title: Applying the chain rule
text: Because the inverse of cot has a function inside its parentheses, "sqrt(4-(x**2))" in this case, we need to apply the chain rule before using the formula from the previous hint. For reference, the chain rule is $$(f(g(x)))'=\operatorname{f'}\left(g{\left(x\right)}\right) \operatorname{g'}\left(x\right)$$.
speech: Because the inverse of cot has a function inside its parentheses, "sqrt(4-(x**2))" in this case, we need to apply the chain rule before using the formula from the previous hint. For reference, the chain rule is  f of g of x prime is equal to f prime, of g of x, g prime, of x .
